content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
No new structures have been successfully built on the map. Multiple recovery attempts to supply Automation Science Packs involved trying to locate, craft, and place a Lab at (0.5, 2.5), but none reached completion due to inventory shortages and resource chain issues. While the agent interacted with existing resource‐processing facilities (an alternative furnace at (5.0, 5.0) for iron smelting and a copper furnace at (–27.0, –60.0) for copper plate production), these were not constructed as part of the current execution steps.

ERROR TIPS
• API Call Misuse – When invoking get_entities, use the correct function signature. Avoid unsupported keyword arguments (such as “radius”) or extra positional arguments to prevent type errors.
• Null Iteration Handling – Verify that results from functions (e.g., get_entities) are not None before iterating over them. Use a fallback (empty list) to ensure safe processing.
• Inventory Verification for Placement – Confirm that the inventory contains the required Lab before attempting to place it. This precheck helps avoid placement errors caused by missing items.
• Lab Crafting Resource Shortfalls – Ensure that all intermediate ingredients required for Lab crafting—such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic circuits, and copper cables—are sufficiently available. Validate the full dependency chain (including smelted iron and copper plates) and confirm that auxiliary production facilities are operational.
• Recipe Dependency Management – Review the crafting recipes and resource throughput so that shortages (for instance, missing iron-gear-wheels or insufficient copper products) do not block complex crafting processes.
